page.title: 09Animals In Thorpe Hesley
page.content: An interesting part of the ecology of Thorpe Hesley is Mangam's pond formed by water soaking away from the pits.It contains lots of species of water plants animals and insects including an endangered species.The Fire Crested newt breeds in Mangam's pond and this is one of the few places it can be found. There are toads, frog, mallard, Great diving beetles,sticklebacks, dragon flys, pond skaters, nymphs, daphnia, grass snake,small eels and waterboatmen.Some people in the village are using the pond as a dump.Some of the things they throw away are toxic and are dangerous to pond life.When the water from the surrounding fields soaks in the nitrogen from fertilizer it makes the pond weed grow and cover the pond.
